Red Lobster, a place I had not visited in years, didst impress me mightily. 
A gift card, my dear GF didst possess, and thus we didst venture in, 
During Lobster Fest, a time of joy and cheer. 
The wait, they didst say, would be some forty-five minutes, 
But lo, we were seated in but twenty, a most pleasant surprise. 
The staff, polite and friendly, didst attend to our needs, 
And the biscuits, oh how they didst delight! 
Specialty cocktails, a true delight, and the specials, 
Didst cater to all tastes, a wondrous sight. 
Two lobster tails, cooked to perfection, didst grace my plate, 
And my GF, her surf and turf, didst savor with glee. 
A complaint, I must lodged, the water in the sink, 
Doth heat up quickly, a minor quibble, I do confess. 
But overall, a grand meal, with service most excellent, 
At a fraction of the cost, a true bargain, indeed."

"Swings, slides, water play - fun for kids, refreshing escape from the sun. But watch out for the crowd, city folk of all kinds, some not so nice. Hardworking folks come for a peaceful time, others, not so much."

"Methinks four trips didst suffice to unearth the cause of mine phone's malfunction. Each sojourn didst proffer a novel perspective on the matter, as if by divine providence. 'Twas not their fault, perchance, that they knew not the answer straightaway. Given they didst strive to amend the problem, I do confess myself content with their endeavors."

"This place, a haven, doth delight. Meatless dishes, many there be, for vegetarians, fear not to ask, 'tis true. Soy-rizo, a substitute, they do provide, for Mexican chorizo, with a couple of entrees, a clever move. Made to order, all doth seem, a sign of care, a mark of esteem. Decor, homely, artistic, not opulent, yet cozy, a pleasant scene. Bring thine own bottle, on certain nights, two entrees and an appetizer, doth grant a complimentary wine, a generous sight. Coffee, freshly brewed, doth make all the difference, a perfect end, a sweet delight. The chef, a friendly soul, didst come forth, to greet and check, a gentle touch, a pleasing sight. A recommendation, I do extend, and shall return, for that chocolate torte, a treat most divine."

"A humble abode, a tranquil scene,
Biscuits and gravy, a meal most serene.
But mark this well, my friends,
Ere break of noon, thou must descend,
Lest thou miss out on breakfast's delight."

"O, fairest hotel, how lovely art thou! No casino's din nor smokers' haze doth mar thy beauty. Thou art a temple of elegance, where comfort doth reign supreme. In thee, I found luxurious bliss, a true lap of indulgence.

"The LCD within the bathroom mirror, a curious delight, didst allow me to brush my teeth while watching t.v., a most convenient pleasure. And though the novelty didst fade, the deep bathtub, fit for two, didst remain a constant joy. Ah, sweet serenity!

"Each morn, we didst order breakfast to our chamber, and lo, the fare was delectable, the service, most excellent. If grace and refinement be thy quest, then Trump Hotel, my friend, is thy haven."

"Hark! A fan of skinnyfats, I do confess,
And once a week, my visits doth not cease.
But lo! Today, my joy didst turn to woe,
For poor service didst my meal doth slow.

A group of four, we sat and didst await,
Our grub, but mine didst not arrive by fate.
My partner asked, with query in his eyes,
The server, who didst reply with scant surprise.

She brought a house salad, with nary a care,
And slammed it down, with gesture most rare.
I said, 'Quinoa salad, chicken, if thou please,'
But she, with haste, didst take it back, with ease.

At last, the correct plate, she didst bring,
And walked away, with nary a word, or ring.
As one who manages service, day and night,
I say, this lass doth need some coaching in sight.

The other employees, with guests didst play,
In friendly wise, their duties didst sway.
But she, with attitude, didst fail, I say,
And thus, my praise, doth go astray.

The food, oh aye! 'Twas wondrous, I confess,
But service, ah! That doth leave much to address."

"Building's a real stunner. If you're in Pittsburgh, stop by and take the tour of the Nationality Rooms. Twenty-odd rooms, each one done up in the style of a different nationality that helped build the city. Check the times before you head over."

"Car service or just passin' through? Head to the Ford dealership, they got a joint servin' up some killer breakfasts. I had the egg and cheese croissant, real good stuff. Would definitely go back, but they lose a star for takin' their sweet time bringin' out the grub."

"This joint? Love it. Margaritas, fajitasâ€”the works. Summerâ€™s the time to go, though. Thatâ€™s when itâ€™s warm. Not that itâ€™s a bad thing, mind you. But if Iâ€™m gonna give it five stars, gotta be perfect. You know?"

"Hark, what tidings bring thee to our neck of woods?  Aye, 'tis Pita Jungle, where victuals are as delectable as those at other establishments.  Verily, the staff doth provide most excellent service, with smiles that doth light up the day.  Alas, the bar area doth seem a mite small, but fear not, for on fair days, the outdoor patio doth provide a most pleasant refuge."

"Hark, what fortune brought me to this place,
Where kindness doth abound in every face?
I sought but take-out, yet didst receive,
A taste of soup, most vegan and relieve.

Their tortillas, soft and fluffy, made,
Didst wrap the burritos, which my heart didst sway.
With lime-infused rice, and beans so black,
Guacamole, fajitas, pico, and salsa on the attack.

My woman too, didst partake in the feast,
Her burrito filled with joy, and love at least.
And though I once didst crave cheese, I swear,
Their chips and queso dip, didst bring me cheer."

"O, fairest Sam Fox, thou art a wizard in the kitchen, conjuring up delectable dishes that doth please mine taste buds. Thy restaurants, including Culinary Dropout, ne'er fail to impress. I have partaken in their bounty many a time, and each visit doth leave me in a state of gastronomical bliss. The service, though not perfect, doth not detract from the joy that thy victuals bringeth. The bloody mary, with its savory bacon, doth quench mine thirst, while the salmon, oh so tender and flavorful, doth delight mine senses. And the pretzels and fondue, by the stars, what a wondrous creation! Thou hast captured mine heart, good sir, and I shall continue to bestow upon thee mine coin, forsooth."

"A new hotel, great indeed, with all things fresh and new.
The King bedroom suite, a sight to behold, doth please me well.
The pool, a sparkling gem, and breakfast spread, most fair.
I shall return, forsooth, to revel in its luxury once more."

"Phoenix airport doth boast a wondrous eatery,
Where travelers may find solace in victuals of the land.
Above the norm, their cuisine doth rise,
Fresh and pure, a delight to the eyes.

Their take on Tex-Mex, a simple yet grand,
Doth please the palate with flavors so bland.
So, weary traveler, seek out this place,
And let thy taste buds revel in joy and grace."

"Noodle factory, you love it? Hell yes, you do. It's the real deal, kid. I know my way around Montreal's Chinatown, seen my fair share of restaurants, but sometimes they don't quite cut it. But Noodle factory, that's the spot. Great noodles, dumplings, all that jazz, and it's cheap too. Cozy place, feels like home. That's where you wanna be."

"Umphrey's 2,000th show. Not bad, sound was good, security was cool. Taffy apple place next door, but we ran late, missed out. Reasonable parking garage a block away, better than Madison street parking."

"Curry Garden, eh? Not exactly swanky inside, but who cares? It's about the grub, right?

I went for the Paneer Tikka Masala, Bhatura, and Garlic Naan. Damn good stuff! Plenty of fresh Paneer, tasty sauce. Bhatura was on point, too - just be sure to devour it while it's still sizzling (dips like a charm). Garlic Naan? Yeah, it had some serious bite. Good shit.

Solid food and service, even if the decor's a bit lackluster. Clean joint, though. 

I'll be back for more of that Paneer magic."

"A most excellent tavern, with a fine array of victuals and potables. The barkeepers, friendly and keen, do serve with haste and diligence. The serving folk, though somewhat hasty in their steps, do strive to please. A merry place, indeed, to watch a game or two, with televisions plentiful as the stars in heaven."

"Methinks I do adore the ambiance of this place,
And the victuals, they didst please my taste.
Forsooth, thou mayst sing and dance, if thou art not afraid,
In this merry tavern, where mirth doth reign supreme."
"Bought a gift cert online in Vegas. Ribeye, perfectly cooked. Sides, great. Creme brulee, fantastic. First-rate joint inside a casino."

"HOB Vegas, a review. Food? Pass. Saw AFI, one of my favorites, but more like their 90's vibe, not the current 2000's version. Venue? Stadium seating, great views, easy in and out, quick bar service upstairs. Prefer this HOB over Anaheim any day. Vegas's 'disneyland' is way cooler than the real thing. No soccer moms trying to run you down with their strollers."

"A hearty breakfast did we enjoy, my dear. Samantha, a vision of loveliness, did grace our table with her presence. Eggs and chorizo, a feast for the taste buds, did we devour with gusto. Alas, the pancakes and muffins, though they did appear most delectable, did we not partake of, for we were full and satisfied with the morning's repast."

"Place was decent, food was great. Lamb and chive dumplings, round and full of flavor. Pork dumplings, crispy outside, juicy inside. But the table, dirty. Floor, stained. Rug, questionable. Don't look down. Give it four stars, not five. Still worth a visit for the grub."

"Habit's a cut above your average burger joint. Like a Carl's Jr. for the refined palate. Menu's alright, service is decent. But damn, parking's a bitch during lunch. Get there early, that's my advice."

"Upon my travels down Smallman, bound for 21 St Coffee,
A tiny sign didst catch mine eye, that read, "Donuts", ye see.
A humble shop, with space enough to make and sell,
I stepped inside, and met Ron, the owner, a merry fellow.

The donuts, made before mine eyes, in a machine so small,
Were cooked to perfection, and oh, how sweet they did smell!
Freshly baked, still warm, of Devils Food, the variety,
Ron dropped them in a bag, with sugar, oh, what a delight!

With mocha in hand, I savored each morsel, oh, how grand!
But alas, good sir, the price, didst give me pause,
For three dollars, a dozen, seemed steep, I must confess.
Yet, freshness and taste, didst make up for the cost, I do suppose.

Four stars, good sir, thy donuts, they didst please,
And though the price, didst pinch my purse, I shall return, anon, to seize."

"A humble abode, this Thai eatery may seem,
But within its walls, a culinary dream doth beckon.
Authentic ambiance, service swift and true,
And dishes, oh so delectable, at prices fair and few.
Their new website, with visual feast doth provide,
For take-out orders, with ease to now decide.
Pad Thai, a classic, doth reign supreme,
And number thirty-five, a flavorful gem.
In Phoenix, seek this restaurant out,
For a taste of Thailand, without a doubt."

"This joint? Love it. Variety? Through the roof. Bread, pretzels, sausages, meats, soups, snacks, picklesâ€”you name it. Wow. Stopped in yesterday, scored a horse-shoe soft pretzel, bag of sticks, and killer dill-lemon-caper-honey mustard. Next time? Stocking up on gummies."

"Hark! Good sir or madam, heed my words of wisdom,
For in this place, a dish most wondrous lies,
'Tis called Malaysian fried rice, a feast most fair,
Unbelievable, indeed, it doth surprise.

And if thou art a fan of sushi, then
The panther roll, a treat most worthy, doth await,
With flavors rich and colors bright, 'twill win
Thy taste buds' hearts, and leave thee in delight.

But, alas, the service here, at times doth falter,
Yet fear not, for the curries, they do make up for't,
In spicy splendor, they doth dance upon thy plate,
A culinary joy, that doth await thy fate.

So, prithee, gentle reader, take my humble advice,
And come, partake of this most wondrous rice,
For in its savory depths, a gustatory paradise,
Doth lie in wait, to make thy senses thrice as nice."

"Clean, modern digs in a safe area. Friendly front desk folk, too. Comfy sitting area, fridge, big TV. But that thermostat? Weird. And don't even get me started on the coffee. Not exactly the best. Oh, and if you're driving an older ride, you might wanna bring a map. GPS won't cut it here. It's a new hotel, so it's not like they can help it. But hey, it's quiet. Real quiet. Till the kiddos start runnin' wild at 7 AM. Then it's like a damn circus. Families, man. They just don't care. Maybe a polite note at check-in? Ask 'em to keep it down? Yeah, I know. Wishful thinkin'."

"A fortnight's sojourn at the Wigwam didst afford me,
For work-related purposes, a most pleasant respite.
A leadership summit, our company didst convene,
And this location proved ideal, most fitting and bright.

The chamber, spacious and well-appointed, didst boast
A wet bar, living room with fireplace, and bed,
Soft and luxurious, that induced sweet slumber,
The best repose I've known, indeed, most divine.

The decor, a blend of Southwest and Ranch, didst charm,
Though modernity, my heart doth truly disarm.
Yet, comfort and relaxation, I didst find,
In this haven, despite its style, so unrefined."

Last eve, I didst meet with friends most dear,
For enchiladas of cheese and drinks of cheer.
This establishment, with service so fine,
Didst provide us with an evening divine.
Their Sonoran-style cuisine, a feast for the taste,
I didst vary my order, with green chile in haste.
Yum, yum, yum, the flavors didst delight,
And vegetarian options, a pleasant sight.
My friend, a regular, doth sing its praise,
A testament to its quality, in many ways.
Though still I search for that elusive red sauce,
This place, in my book, doth earn a favorable pause.

"A watch speaks volumes of its owner. It can be a symbol of status, style, and wealth. I don't need a watch to tell me the time, my phone does that just fine. And honestly, watches are a bit too fancy for my taste. I prefer my ill-fitting suit and scuffed up sneakers. They tell people where I stand just fine. But for you watch enthusiasts out there, this little shop might feel like a treasure trove."

"Hark! If thou hast not seen this place before, 'Tis worth thine while to venture forth and explore. Forsooth, a ticket doth cost but twenty crowns, And within, thou shalt find diversions galore. Aye, drinks and victuals, too, they doth abound, As three-penny soda, five-penny ale, and seven-and-a-half penny turkey legs, With brownie and ice-cream, five crowns doth command. But, gentle visitor, heed my words of wisdom, Bring sunscreen and hat, for 'tis a long, hot day, And things to buy, they doth come dear, I pray thee, be prepared. Yet, fear not, for there doth be shows aplenty, A little bit of all, for every soul to enjoy."

"Diamond in the rough, no doubt. Neighborhood's a bit rough, but this joint shines. Charcuterie platter, top-notch. Prices, fair. Staff, eager. Duck egg ravioli, winner. Brown butter, fried swiss chard, perfect combo. Foie gras mousse, creamy, flavorful. Fig paste, nice touch. Eat like kings, drink wine, dessert, prosecco. Total, under $120. If I lived nearby, I'd frequent the charcuterie platter, no question."

"Hark! Good sir or madam, do not miss this place,
My friend doth live nearby, and we have found grace
In breakfast visits, oft and frequent, 'tis true,
The coffee, rich and smooth, doth please my taste anew.
A vanilla latte, sweet and velvety, doth reign,
A favorite, indeed, among their offerings profane.
The menu, diverse and quaint, doth pique my interest,
Yet, I, a glutton, find myself enthralled,
By short rib burritos, savory, oh so fine,
A dish most delectable, fit for a king's design.
But, alas! The portions, large and overflowing,
Do leave me sated, ere my meal be going.
I pray, good sir, a to-go box, forthwith,
Lest I, in haste, devour all, like some wild beast.
The wait, a trifle long, yet, service swift and bright,
Doth make amends, and doth dispel the morning's blight.
But, comfortless seating, a minor drawback, I confess,
And healthy choices, scarce, save for their willingness
To substitute, with grace, and accommodate,
A boon, indeed, for those who seek a lighter fate.
So, prithee, gentle reader, heed my words of cheer,
And visit this spot, where culinary joys appear."

"A fair eatery indeed, where hospitality doth flow.
I chanced upon the married pair, so warm and welcoming,
Their culinary skills, a true delight, did show.
A hearty meal, with prompt attendance, did they bring.
I shall return, forsooth, to savor their fare once more."

"In fair Edinburgh, where wondrous sights abound,
A hunger pang did strike, and rest did seek.
A cafe, recommended, alas, didst shut its door,
So here, within this bistro, didst I entreat.

Quiet, cozy, with but few patrons nigh,
A table found, and ordered forthwith.
Avocado salad, healthful choice, didst crave,
With water, pure, to quench thirst, didst wave.

Waitress, kind, didst show me to my seat,
And swift, my salad came, with bread, a treat.
But, alas, too much vinaigrette didst pour,
Dripping, the leaves didst, in oil, a sore.

A star, deducted, for this mistake, I say,
Yet still, wouldst return, for service, good, didst play."

"A wondrous place, indeed, where fine ale flows free,
And victuals of the finest sort doth please the eye.
But alas, my friends, a group of six or more,
Shall find it hard to gain a table, by the door.
For reservations, they do not keep, nor hold,
So come ye early, lest ye be left cold."
"Spinach rice and beans, excellent. Slow service, waited 10 minutes for tea. Busy lunch spot, but worth it for the grub."

"Little Nippers II, ordered multiple times. Happy with the food, but it ain't fast food. Good food takes time, like their mild wings. Skip the packet of dressing, use quality blue cheese instead. Their pizza is alright, but nothing like the ones back in New York. Will be back, but will call in or GrubHub my order next time to avoid the wait."
"Fish sandwiches, love 'em. All they're cracked up to be. Lunch, try one. Order ahead, pick up. Thirty minutes, more, wait. Smoky bar, soda machine. Ten bucks, worth it."

"A most excellent place, indeed! My love and I didst oft visit the establishment in Mesa, but alas! The manager, a wicked witch, didst ne'er show us any courtesy. We didst cease to patronize that location, but lo! We didst give the Bell Rd. site a chance. Hark! The service was superb! A warm smile didst greet us, and straightway, we were seated. Our server, a diligent lad, didst attend to our needs with haste. The victuals, most delectable! I didst order a skillet, my heart's desire, and my spouse, the Eye Opener Combo, his favorite dish. By my troth, we are elated to include this eatery once more in our circuit of delightful morning haunts!"

"A merry time doth await thee on this tour of chocolate delight,
'Tis free, my friends, and full of sweetness and light.
Amidst the cacti, a wondrous sight doth lie,
And at the end, a treat doth await thee, a taste most divine.
I speak of Creme Liqueurs, a delicacy most fine,
If thou hast not tried them, thou art truly missing out, my friend."

"In Mekong Plaza's restaurants, there's nary a dud,
But Wholly Grill, a gem, deserves a second nod.
We sought a meal both good and cheap,
And thus didst venture forth, our taste buds to keep.

The food court beckoned, and we didst stray,
To sample dishes of the local way.
Wholly Grill, our choice, didst not betray,
Our hunger sated, we didst end the day.

I chose the pork belly, oh so fair,
My partner, skewers, with eggplant rare.
Both dishes, delicious, beyond compare,
The flavors danced, our senses to ensnare.

The staff, kind and friendly, didst declare,
The pork belly, their recommendation most fair.
We laughed and smiled, our bellies full and round,
Our taste buds, happy, our spirits astound.

Oh, how I yearn for that pork belly now,
My craving, strong, doth never slack.
I shall return, my friends, make no mistake,
For more of that dish, my heart doth ache."

"A tiny vanilla chai tea latte didst I procure,
To sip upon my way, with nary a care.
The cup, just right for me, didst fit like a glove,
And tasted most divine, beyond compare.

But lo, the price didst give me pause,
For three silver pieces, quite a steep cost, I'd say.
Yet still, I drank it with joy and delight,
For 'twas worth every penny, come what may."

"Hark! A friend and I didst partake in Restaurant Week's delight,
At a quaint, charming establishment, with atmosphere so bright.
The calamari, alas! Was cooked a mite too long,
But all else was divine, and service, it didst throng.
Bring thine own vino, lest thou wish to pay the price,
For their cellar doth lack variety, and cost, 'twill pinch."

"Methought we craved a meal most light,
And thus didst choose this place aright.
A fan of sushi and sashimi, I,
Didst find their menu most invitingly.

We opted for small share plates, six in all,
And found them fresh and tasty, one and all.
The sauces, too, didst please our taste,
And service, friendly, efficient, and fast.

Indeed, we wouldst dine here once more,
For this place hath won our hearts o'er."

"By chance, I stumbled upon this bakery while on other errands in the area. The sweet aroma of fresh bread wafting from within was too enticing to resist, and I found myself stepping inside for a brief visit. They had an array of delights for a satisfying meal: bread, pastries, cakes, quiches, cheeses, and pre-prepared dishes ready to be warmed at home. I sampled their bread with honey and nuts, which was simply divine. However, I left with a loaf of raisin and nut bread that was cut to my liking. It was a dense bread with a solid crust but not too difficult to eat, and a soft interior that didn't make too many crumbs. If this bakery were closer to my home, I would likely be a regular customer!"

"This joint's jumpin', full of cool cats and kittens. Didn't know it'd be such a hot spot. Casino's still got me scratchin' my head, but maybe that's 'cause I ain't a regular. Will call desk took some findin', but finally got there with the help of a friendly face. Everyone's in high spirits, young and ready to party. Parkin's a pain, but that's what you get for goin' underground. Lightin' could use a boost, feel like I'm in purgatory. Saw New Order play by the pool, great show even though I ain't a huge fan of poolside concerts. Pool deck's tiny, packed like sardines, but the set list was top-notch, even threw in some Joy Division tunes. Fans who dipped out early missed out, losers! True fans stick around 'til the bitter end. Had a blast, met some cool Yelp folks for the first time."

"Our ceaseless pursuit of boba tea, a month long quest,
Led us to Sesame House, a place unjustly named,
Within Chinatown Plaza, a mall of wonder,
A sign outside proclaims, "No. 1 Boba", in thunder.

Their tea, a second best, next to Tea Planet's brew,
But prices here, more kindly, on the purse, doth do.
Atmosphere, sparse, yet fruit, fresh as the dew,
And dried fruits, aplenty, for all to pursue."

"Verily, this Thai food doth please mine taste,
With beef jerky, pad thai, papaya salad, and rice so bright.
Their tea, a vast and wondrous brew, doth fill my cup,
And though the site may lack, the service doth make up.
I shall return, for here I find my heart's desire,
In this fair Thai food, which doth my senses fire."

"Verily, I have traversed this airport oftener than Anna Nicole Smith's apothecaries didst venture forth to the Bahamas. 'Tis a maze within, yet without, a true labyrinth doth lie. Which lane doth lead to yonder 202? The left, perchance? Nay, now the middle? And then, a hundred paces further, the left once more? Pray tell, what mirth doth these traffic wardens find in their Cheetos and Dr. Pepper, as they watch poor travelers navigate this winding course? Fear not, fair reader, for services herein are passable, mayhap even good, with taverns, eateries, and shoppes aplenty. Yet, why doth others bemoan their lack? A tapster, a victual, a telly, Dramamine, the National Enquirer, and that horseshoe-shaped cushion which doth make me feel the fool whenever I produce it - these be all I require."

"Four fifths of sweet peril doth lie within these confections,
Oh my, how sugar doth entice with its alluring presence!
Bars of delight, a feast for the taste buds, how they do beckon,
Yet, alack, I fear for my waistline, should I partake too often.
For in town, on business I do travel, and thus, my access
To these delectable treats, doth bring me joy, yet also fear,
Lest I succumb to their sweet allure, and my pants no longer fit,
And I, in shame, must purchase new garb, to hide my plight."

"Hark! What light through yonder terminal breaks?
A chicken and biscuits doth my hunger slake.
In sooth, 'tis a fine repast, fit for a king,
Or e'en a poet, such as I, in flight.

Well done, fair North Carolina, thy victuals be
A worthy sustenance for travelers such as me.
Keep up the excellent work, that all may see
Thy bounty and generosity, in abundance free."

"Hark! What wonders lie within this gaming hall,
A space so fresh and fair, it doth enthrall.
The pits, so modern and sleek, do shine,
And public restrooms, new and fine.
A food court, inviting and neat,
Doth offer sustenance, fit for a treat.
Though old, this place doth have a new face,
A testament to its enduring grace.
May fortune smile upon this place,
And keep its spirit in its chosen space."

"Hark, good sir or madam, let it be known,  
This Trader Joe's doth offer wares most fine and bright.  
Their parking lot, alas, doth leave much to be desired,  
A place where insurance premiums should be required.  

In truth, I park afar, to avoid the fray,  
Lest elderly patrons doth crash and play the day.  
But fear not, dear friends, for this doth not deter,  
My love for this TJ's, which doth be near my chamber.  
I shall return, again and again, to savor  
Their goods, and perhaps, a parking spot to favor."

"Poppy's Bagels, a delightful find. Met Tonya P, a charming lady, for a quick bite. Toasted bagels, crunchy and carby, paired well with homemade cream cheese. Chive and vegetable spreads, both satisfying. Riley, my pup, enjoyed the patio, despite the noise from passing cars. Will return for another tasty bagel and quality time with good company."

"French fries, oh how my mind doth dwell on thee!
Batter-dipped, I do suspect, before they didst fry.
A buffalo chicken sandwich, verily, didst please,
And large the menu, with options for all to seize.
Open and airy, fit for groups to gather round,
With televisions many, for sporting events profound.
Thou art not unlike an Applebee's, I must confess,
Yet still, I shall return, for those fries, I must possess."

"Hark! What wonders lie within Buca Di Beppo's walls,
Their dishes vast, their flavors rich and full.
A feast fit for a king, or so it seems,
Yet portioned for but two or four, it teems.
But fear not, for the pasta's cooked to perfection,
And sauces savory, a true delightful fusion.
This place, so crowded, doth require a reservation,
For dinner hours, a wise decision, 'tis my observation."

"Verily, a feast most fair doth lie within this hall,
Where sushi and teppan, both great and small, do please.
The servers, gracious and kind, do tend to our needs,
And appetizers, delicious, do our taste buds feed.

Alas, the prices, somewhat steep they be,
But fear not, for coupons, locals may see.
A roll, tofu, filet, seaweed salad, and teppan too,
All dishes, vegetarian, that our hunger doth subdue.

So come, my friends, and partake in this treat,
For in this restaurant, a meal most meet, doth await."

"Oyshi Sushi, thou hast taken my sushi innocence! Prices, oh how I wish they were lower, alas, hope doth spring eternal. AYCE, the surest path for a feast with friends, lest ye worry o'er dishes in the back, for some may partake too freely. Alas, there be those whose pockets do not match their palates, and thus, we find ourselves at Oyshi. 

Service, a hit or miss affair, some servers, kind and attentive, others, lacking in their duties. Take-out, a viable option, indeed. 

Alack, no half-orders here, and far from the strip it be, a double-edged sword, for though the wait be long, 'tis worth the journey. Mussels, Love Affair, Lobster Fair, Oyshi Roll, and Japanese Lasagna, my heart doth sing with joy at their mention!"

"This joint's been our go-to since it opened. Teppan chefs always put on a show, cookin' up a storm with flair and personality. Owners Barry and Ahn, they're the real deal, too. Friendly as can be, they make sure everyone's happy. They know their regulars and welcome 'em back like old friends. Happy Hour's got a killer menu, sushi's always fresh. Yeah, it can get loud, but it's a fun kinda noise. They got a big ol' patio, too. Catchin' an Arizona sunset from there? You won't regret it. Been comin' here for years, and we ain't stoppin' now."

"Hark, what cheer! We doth arrive on Tuesday eve,
For celebration feast, our bellies to relieve.
Groupon, the wondrous deal, doth grant us boon,
Two for $36, a price most fair and soon.

Afore we sat, our visage doth adorn the screen,
A smile, a laugh, a moment of pure delight, 'twas seen.
The fare, a medley of diverse sorts, doth please,
Salads, soups, Mex, Mid-East, Asian, Americ, Italian treats.

AYCD, the drinks, doth flow like liquid gold,
Beer, wine, champagne, life's nectar, stories untold.
Neyo, the ladies doth agree, with nods and grins,
The strawberry crumb cupcake, a sweet delight within.

Cotton candy, a treat for younglings, doth bring joy,
No crab legs, alas, but sushi, a poor employ.
Mexican, salads, American, doth make up the rest,
Drinks, the highlight, food, a middling quest.

Thirty-six, the sum, or eighteen per head,
A fair price, for victuals and potions, so dread.
Tis true, the food, not bad, but average, we find,
Yet, drinks, most satisfying, the mind doth unwind."

"Hark! A tale of culinary delight,
In a place that's not quite bakery, nor quite right.
A sterile cafe, with bread and pastries galore,
But cozy, it is not, that's for sure.

I sat with a friend from Bosnia, who did order for me,
A dish called cevapi, a sight to see.
A round bread, freshly baked, hot and oiled,
Cut in half, like a burger, but no patty, just sausage filled.

The bread was delicious, the sausage tasty too,
But alas, I could not finish, my belly was not accustomed to.
I'd do it again, but next time, I'd save some room,
For those tasty pastries, that caught my eye, in the Bosnian bakery's gloom.

The owners were kind, but the service, oh so strange,
No checks on you, just tell them what you'll have, and pay, no range.
I liked it well, as a guest in their domain,
No need for Hooters' waitresses, here, all is serene."

"Hark, what speedy service doth this place possess!
The atmosphere, it doth delight and bless.
A sandwich named Leo's, I didst partake,
And found it to be a most excellent choice, by my troth.
Even the water, it doth taste most fine and sweet.
But alas, a wait list, they have not mastered yet,
It seemeth unorganized, and caused some discontent.
Thus, four stars, I do give, for now, I pray,
That they may learn, and their wait list, arrange in array."
"This joint's got top-notch service. Friendly folks, quick checkouts. Organic veggies, quality stuff. Decent beer selection, not just the usual crap. Baking supplies, impressive. Worth the trip."

"Four stars, I give to this place,
For service most kind and fair of face.
Their sandwiches and pizza, I have tried,
And found them to be just satisfactory.
But the staff, oh so pleasant and bright,
Maketh my visit a joyous sight."

"Verily, the service here doth please me well,
Though prices be steep, 'twill not deter me still.
Two omelets for eighty coins, and drinks beside,
No ale, but juice and coffee, shall be my guide.

In Las Vegas, all things come with a cost,
Yet food, oh food, doth make my heart feel lost.
By the pool we did dine, and lingered long,
For outside seats, a short stroll did take us throng.
The patio, alas, doth not always stay open wide,
But still, 'twas worth it, to bask in sunshine's pride."

"A bustling, vibrant tavern, full of cheer and delight,  
With flavorsome Mexican dishes, priced just right.  
The working class, in droves, do come to dine,  
For they know well the value of a hearty meal divine."

"Verily, a most excellent repast we didst enjoy, my daughter and I, at this establishment. Our victuals, in sooth, didst delight us, for they were prepared with great skill and care. A capri sandwich on ciabatta, I didst partake of, and my daughter, a turkey and bacon on ciabatta, didst savor. The young man who didst attend to us, his name I didst not gather, but his demeanor was most pleasant and helpful. He didst answer all our queries with great patience and cheer. We shall, anon, return to this place, forsooth."

"Sushi Style, I stopped by for lunch today. Not too busy, even at peak hour. Waitress was great, brought me a refreshing glass of iced tea with lemon right away. Had a tootsie roll, eel sauce with crunchy crab California roll, and an Arizona roll. All were damn good. Will definitely be back soon for more."

"Hark, good sir! I do confess,
This place doth hold a special charm,
For Tina, she who doth possess
The skill to make my nails disarm.

A little out of my way, 'tis true,
But still, the best place I've found anew,
She doth make them even, thin and neat,
As I desire, her skills to greet.

Three weeks, alas! That's all I can,
Betwixt each fill, her art to scan,
But still, her work doth please me well,
And prices, fair, that doth compel.

So, gentle reader, take my word,
And visit this place, thou art implored,
For Tina's touch doth make it divine,
And thou shalt leave, in love, entwined."
"Lunch buffet's a steal at $13.99. Mix of veggie, chicken, pork, and beef. Naan bread's top-notch. Keep bringin' it on out! Only downside's the post-meal nap. Can't avoid it."

"A hearty welcome didst we receive, with service most kind and true. A tour of the premises didst they provide, most informative and new. Alas, the beer garden lay dormant, locked in winter's chill, yet still we savored brews of finest quality, our thirst to fulfill."

"Verily, 'tis a place most wondrous, where bagels doth reign supreme. A breakfast haven, by my troth, with challah that doth please, save when 'tis a tad suspect, as my Jewish friend doth say. But fear not, fair maiden, for Chompies bagels thou mayst find at yonder market, an added boon indeed."

"Hark, good sir, to Los Dos's grand delight,  
A Chimichanga most wondrous in sight.  
Deep-fried and garnished with verdant green,  
Guacamole, sour cream, and chili serene.  
A feast fit for monarchs, a treat for the taste,  
Worthy of praise, and a dish of great haste.  
Alas, if they offered refills of chips and salsa,  
Their fame would spread far, like a mighty river's pulse.  
But still, their margaritas and brews are fine,  
A drink to savor, a pleasure divine."

"Chicago had this joint, now Pittsburgh's got one too. I hit it up today, knowing what to expect from a franchise. Consistency's key, no matter where you are. This place delivers, just like I remembered. Affordable, quick, and tasty. Sure, there's better, cheaper, and faster spots out there. But finding all three in one? That's a rare combo. That's why it gets four stars from me. And hell, it's near my work too."
"Tough to locate, but worth the effort. Solid tacos, hospitable cook."

"Hark, my dearest! This Wendy's, newly adorned,
Didst catch our eye, and we didst decide
To step inside and view the changes made.
The remodel, quite extensive, hath rearranged
The way one orders and doth pick up their fare.
Now, in one place, thou doth order thy meal,
And in another, thou doth retrieve it, anon.
The dining space, once drab and lackluster,
Hath been transformed, with new tables, a fresh coat of paint,
Even a tiny corner for the little ones to play.
And, by the way, good sir, Wi-Fi is available,
For those who wish to surf the net, while they dine."
"Lunch spot's almost okay. Not too pricey, nice ambiance. Limited menu options though."

St. Francis, a swell spot for brunch in Phoenix. Classy joint with a pinch of trendiness. American grub with a mix of flavors. Nice selection of brews, and mimosas and Bloody Marys with brunch. Kids under 10 eat free, too.

Friendly staff, always. No slow service here. Food takes a bit, but that's not the server's fault. They're on top of your drink, asking when it's running low.

Eggs benedict with salmon, my go-to. Hollandaise sauce, tangy and buttery perfection. Used to come with fingerling potatoes, now just a few on the plate. Pork chile verde, spicy and seasoned just right. Served with corn bread for the stew. Cioppino, a spicy seafood stew, big enough to share. Great for happy hour, too, with apps and drinks by the fire on the patio. A real treat.

"Hark! Switch doth offer diverse victuals, ranging from wholesome fare to hearty indulgence. Their menu, a true potpourri, hath ne'er failed to impress. Generous portions, at a fair cost, doth satisfy my hunger. Service, too, doth please, with nary a frown or scowl. My favorites? Mac and cheese, rich and creamy, with penne pasta; caprese sandwich, with fresh pesto vinaigrette; and a classic burger, unpretentious, yet full of flavor. And should thou seek to quaff a few, their drink specials, on Sundays, are most excellent. Carafes of mimosas and bloody marys, for a mere $3, doth make merry thy day!"

"Five years have we been patrons of this chain,
Their victuals and potions we do proclaim.
This place, though new, doth bustle with activity,
Yet staffing levels, on weekends, do vary.
A wait of twenty minutes, sometimes doth occur,
But generally, 'tis less than five, forsooth.

Their fare and drinks, most excellent, I say,
But cleanliness, a problem, doth persist.
In particular, the privy, ne'er doth shine,
My children, young, I dare not let them incline.

'Tis vexing, indeed, for staff, quite friendly,
And manager, seemingly, most capable, doth appear.
Yet, how the single bathroom, doth escape their eye?
A mystery, it doth remain, and cause me dismay.

Despite this flaw, a favorite still, 'tis true,
We visit oft, our loyalty, unshaken, doth endure."

Hark! 'Tis a tale of Pho Viet Nam, a place most fair,
Where soups and servings do delight beyond compare.
A weekly visit, give or take, doth prove their worth,
For consistency, a virtue, doth forever birth.

The pho, a soup of note, doth please the taste,
Improved, yet still, above all others in haste.
In busy times or slow, the service doth shine,
A testament to crew and staff, most divine.

Chandler's gem, this Vietnamese delight,
Doth bring us joy, with each passing night.
So here's to thee, Pho Viet Nam, and all thy kin,
May your endeavors flourish, as doth your pho within.

"Hark! If thou dost seek familiar spices and groceries,
Ask any Asian, and they shall reveal,
A place where cultures meet, in aisles so neat,
With labels clear, for all to conceive.

Not just for Asians, but all may come,
And find their need, in this vast domain,
Of 'water animals', fresh baked treats,
And bubble tea, to quench thy thirst and heat.

A small dining space, with Chinese fare,
Doth serve, and make thy taste buds aware,
That this place, though far, is worth the quest,
For all thy Asian cuisine requests."

"Marry, how strange it doth seem to mine eyes,
That any soul would hold In-N-Out in higher esteem,
Than Lenny's, where the patties be plump and full of life,
The cheese, a rich and creamy delight, doth make me swoon,
And fries, oh fries, so crispy and golden brown,
Do leave In-N-Out's offering in the dust, I do avow.

For though the burger of In-N-Out may taste fair,
'Tis naught but a shadow of Lenny's finest fare,
Whose patties beefy, cheese a noble wheel,
And fries, a hundredfold better, doth reveal.

So, nay, I do not think In-N-Out doth reign supreme,
For Lenny's, in my heart, doth hold the crown, it doth seem."

"Alas, I knew not of health insurance's grace,
So paid I must for dental services' embrace.
Compared to others in the area, the cost did seem fair,
And lo! An internet coupon, $100 off to spare.
Biltmore Commons Dental Care, its name did ring,
With Google's praise, my doubts did quickly cling.
I called at dawn, an appointment soon didst make,
Perhaps fortune smiled upon me, forsooth, the stake.
Dr. Balestrino, skilled in his craft, did say,
My fillings needed tending, come what may.
He explained his work, my queries did allay,
And now, content I am, this dentist visit to play.
Back shall I come, in six months' time, to keep,
My teeth clean, and thus, my smile, to reap."

"A place most dear, where we do often doth procure  
Our noontide meal, with naught but joy and cheer.  
Their sandwiches and salads, a feast for our taste,  
Do please us well, and ne'er do we find waste.  
Their service, too, doth merit our highest praise,  
For courteous folk, with smiles upon their faces.  
And though we have not tried each dish they bear,  
We know not any that doth not bring us cheer."

"Methinks I am a fan of Yoforia, indeed,
These yogurt shops spring up like weeds in seed,
A clever concept, self-serve, then weigh,
The price and flavor, a wondrous array.

At times, the queue doth stretch and wind,
But fear not, for it moveth swiftly, kind,
And if thou art impatient, take a stroll,
Around the mall, and let the line dwindle, whole."

"Methinks 'tis a grand gymnasium indeed,
With facilities most fair and ample space.
But alas, I didst encounter a slight quirk,
When I, a member, could not gain entrance,
For want of my I.D., a woeful mistake.
I voiced my discontent, and all was well,
The issue resolved, my grief didst quickly flee.
Yet, mark this well, good sirs and madams,
The customer service, a trifle lacking,
And some employees, their courtesy not always apt.
But fear not, for the rest, all doth excel,
E'en at midnight, when the crowds doth dwindle,
And lo, 'tis open twenty-four hours, a boon most bountiful."

"Friendly staff, clean digs. Portions? Huge. Mexican grub? Not the best I've had, but it'll do when I'm hankerin'. I tell myself I'll only eat half, save the rest for later. Doesn't work. I stuff my face 'til it's all gone. That stuff's like crack."

"Hark! What grumbling do mine ears perceive? 
Aye, 'tis the crowd, with disdain they do conceive, 
This place, they say, doth reek of pretence, 
But, my dear friends, that's its charm, in truth, it doth dispense. 

The layout, neat and tidy, doth impress, 
And samples, freely given, do delight, 
But alas, the line, on weekends, doth grow long, 
So come, my friends, on weekdays, and thus, thy wait, doth shorten. 

The capsules, too, doth Nespresso take, 
For recycling, and thy data, doth it make, 
No need to recall, each detail, by thine own mind, 
For they, in files, doth keep, thy information, so kind. 

Oh, how Nespresso doth improve my morn, 
With coffee, rich and smooth, my day, doth adorn, 
So here, I'll stay, and savour, each delight, 
In this, my haven, free from trouble and fright."

"This Starbucks' layout doth please mine eyes,
With ample space for all to sit and sip.
But, alas! On our visit, the team didst not
Keep the place clean, as it should be.
The trash can o'erflowed, and tables unwipe,
A sight most foul, and displeasing to mine sight.
Yet, the staff were friendly, and that doth count,
For friendliness doth weigh heavy in mine book.
So, four stars doth this Starbucks receive,
But, methinks they should attend to the environment with greater zeal,
And ensure that food items be stocked aright,
That they may earn the full five stars, anon."

"A feast most wondrous, fit for royalty,
The buffet's spread, a true delight.
Some dishes, bold and full of zest,
Others, mild, yet still a joy to taste.
Mango ice cream, sweet and pure,
But mango lassi, oh, how it's obscured!
Whipped cream, a needless addition,
Detracts from the drink's true sensation.
Staff, attentive and most kind,
Eager to serve, their guests they find.
Curry, not fiery hot, but still,
A blend of spices, skillfully wrought."

"Methinks 'tis a wondrous sight,
This Bandera, where I do take flight.
In days of yore, I've supped there oft,
But one dish doth stand out, a true gem aloft.
Their Dip Duo, with chips of tortilla, doth delight,
And Mojitos, strong and full of zest, doth ignite.
A fine place, Bandera, to begin the night,
With appetizers savory, and drinks that doth excite."

"Methinks my dearest friend didst come to Vegas for a day,
To visit me and see the wondrous sights,
We went to dine and have a drink or two,
At one of the new hotels, with grand delight.

We shared a pizza, grilled with veggies galore,
And I didst order a cocktail, special and more,
With Grey Goose, lime, mint, and water, a fine blend,
'Twas truly yummy, my taste buds didst attend.

My friend didst have a margarita, on the rocks,
And didst enjoy it so much, she had three, no shocks,
For she was on holiday, and didst wish to play,
And the service was good, with nary a fray.

The views outside were stunning, a true sight to behold,
A fitting end to our merry day, so bold."

In fair Montreal, where China Town doth meet the eye,
A Dim Sum place doth lie, within a mall's embrace.
The food, though greasy, doth please the palate well,
And atmosphere, fitting for a Dim Sum spell.

Many have compared this place to others far and wide,
But I, who've had Dim Sum in Shanghai's streets, do find
It comparable, in its own humble, modest way,
To those in cities grand, where Chinese cuisine doth sway.

Yet, in my search for xiaolongbao, steamed with care,
I seek a place, like Din Tai Fung, beyond compare.
For though Shanghai may boast both good and bad,
I crave a taste that's truly authentic, not so sad.

"In this fair establishment, the setting doth please,
With ample space for rest and relaxation's ease.
The service, too, doth shine with friendliness and grace,
Eager to guide thy choices with a smile on their face.

The food, oh how divine! A steak of such quality,
Thy taste buds shall dance with joy and revelry.
But, alas, the mushrooms, they didst not impress,
For they upon my tongue didst leave a foul mess.

Yet still, this place doth earn my highest praise,
For steak and service, both doth bring delight.
So, gentle reader, heed my words of cheer,
And visit here, thou shalt not regret, I swear."

"Good to see a joint do it right and get paid for it. This place, Toast, knows what's up. Had the Cobb Salad with the missus for lunch - damn good. 

This spot's seen some turnover, but Toast's showin' it ain't the location's fault. It's the product, like it usually is. 

Solid. Didn't give 'em five stars though, 'cause it got too loud to chat across the table. Might just be a side effect of their popularity, but still a problem."

"Methinks I've visited this fair store ten times in two years past,
And each time, good service have I found, and cheerful chat,
Their wares of women's running gear and yoga attire, most vast,
Have brought me joy, and made my heart feel light and free.

If e'er a return or exchange didst need to be made,
'Twas done with haste and smiles, and no ill will displayed.
I do confess, my dear, this shop doth hold a special place,
In my heart, for its kind folk and their gentle grace."

"Oh, fair sir or madam, do thou seek  
The Kobe sliders, for they be most divine.  
A craving doth consume me, night and day,  
For those delectable morsels, so fine and gay.  
And with a BBQ dipping sauce, they doth come,  
A flavor so rich, it doth leave one undone.  
But alack, the wait, it doth seem so long,  
For on the weekends, 'tis a crowded throng.  
And though the outdoor seats, they doth appear,  
So inviting, yet they doth disappear.  
A pool and fountains, they doth grace the scene,  
But for a table, one must wait, I ween.  
Yet fear not, for a full bar doth abide,  
In this fair establishment, where one may reside.  
And thus, my friends, I doth recommend,  
The cobb salad, chili, turkey club, and cheese fond.  
For though the prices be a bit on the steep,  
The quality of the fare, doth make it worthwhile to keep."

In sooth, fair Vdara doth provide a peaceful respite from the Strip's maddening crowd, with spacious chambers, diligent service, and pleasant amenities. Twice have I graced its halls, and each time, I found solace in its tranquil embrace. The rooms, indeed, are capacious, accommodating three travelers with ease. A blessing, that, for those who seek refuge from the din and smoke of yonder casinos.

Located at the southern end of the Strip, Vdara doth enjoy a secluded spot, removed from the fray. A trifle distant, mayhap, yet naught but a brief stroll doth separate it from Bellagio's grand entrance. Cosmopolitan, alack, doth require a somewhat longer trek, though hardly an insurmountable feat.

Methinks, dear friend, that Vdara doth cater to those who seek a calmer Vegas experience. The pool, in sooth, doth mirror the hotel's serene ambiance, a haven from the riotous revelry that doth characterize other such watering holes.

Verily, I shall return anon, for Vdara hath won my heart with its gentle charms. And, mark my words, thou shalt find it easily, shouldst thou seek a mystery hotel on Hotwire, with naught but a southward Strip locale, five stars, and a non-gaming atmosphere to guide thee. Farewell, Las Vegas, until we meet again!

"Hark, fair friends! Last week, I chanced upon AAP,
For luncheon, and oh, what joy didst it bring!
The hour was late, and few didst dine within,
So I, a hostess, didst choose my seat with ease.
A comfy booth, so large and plush, didst beckon me,
And thus, I sat, with nary a soul to trouble thee.

My server, swift and kind, didst tend to me,
And asked if I had questions, as well as my decree.
The soft pretzel, with beer cheese, didst catch mine eye,
And thus, I ordered it, with haste, didst not deny.
'Twas large, indeed, and hot, with crunch outside,
And soft within, a treat, most satisfying, I avow.

Still, hunger pangs didst plague me, so I didst add,
A spinach salad, with tomato, cranberries, and feta, not bad.
A nut, perhaps, to change the texture, might be nice,
But overall, 'twas a salad, most pleasant, and quite nice.

They have, it seems, drink specials, through the week,
A place, so grand, where one might watch a game, with ease.
Four stars, I gave, for more lunch options, they shouldst seek,
Beyond salads, sandwiches, and entrees, which start at five, I do beseech.

Yet, verily, 'twas great, and I shall return, anon,
To AAP, where food, and drink, didst make my day, so bright and sun."

"I was hesitant 'bout a revolvin' sushi bar, but damn, Teharu's got some rave reviews. And let me tell ya, it delivers. Fun spot, good eatin', cheap too. They got all sorts of dishes for 1.50-2.50 a pop. I mean, you can try a lot without breakin' the bank. Fresh fish, big beers, and fillin' portions. Give it a shot."
"Good steak, fair price. Friendly staff, clean joint. No butter, no fuss. Veggies, seasonings, all good. Warm bread, tasty. Private booths by the bar, date night spot. Overall, A+."

"Methinks 'tis fortunate indeed to have this eatery nigh my dwelling place! Aye, what doth make it even more desirable, good sirs, were it to possess a patio, whereupon mine own canine companion might join me. A fair price, I say, and verily, the red curry didst please mine taste buds."

Halt! Good sir or madam, prithee tarry awhile,
And purchase yonder dill Havarti, 'tis worth thine while.
Taste a morsel, nay, taste many, forsooth,
Thou shalt find others that please thee, in truth.

"Hark! Le Petit Moulinsart, a place so quaint,
In Vieux Montreal, upon Rue St Paul's street,
A haven for those seeking late repast,
With Belgian fare, their specialty, no doubt.

The name, from comic strip of old,
Moulinsart, a chateau of great renown,
And thus, the restaurant doth follow suit,
With mussels, their crowning glory, no doubt.

Steamed in broths of varied hue,
Four dishes we did try, anon,
Two stood out, excelling all the rest,
But choose any, and thou shalt be blessed.

For at LPM, they cook with skill and care,
Mussels plump, tender, and juicy, beyond compare,
Baguettes, complimentary, to soak up the broth,
A salad, to round off the meal, in good health.

Verily, the second-best mussels, I do swear,
Bertha's, in Fells Point, doth hold the first chair."

"Hark, what wondrous feast doth lie before mine eyes!
A veritable cornucopia of greasy delights,
Fried to a golden crisp, most delectable and fine.
The white trash burger, with its fried pickle and onions,
Doth tempt my taste buds, and the sweet potato fries,
A culinary marvel, doth complete this gastronomic symphony.
I highly recommend these dishes, for they doth satisfy
And fill mine belly with delightful, savory joy."

"SLS, Lux tower wing. Easy access to train. Bought 24-hour passes. Fast, convenient ride to The Linq. Sunday, barely anyone around. I prefer trains during the day. Enjoyable experience, just remember to wear flats."

"Corner of Saint-Laurent and Fairmount, bright and airy joint. Lunchtime, mix of new moms, power lunchers, ladies, refined gents sipping beer. Menu's brief, grilled cheese, salads, charcuterie, pastas, stews, hash. My $15 corned beef hash, runny sunnyside up egg, chef's hat tip. Corned beef, juicy, flaky, melt in your mouth. Arguably pricey, but rich flavors, right size. Arugula salad, spicy kick. Dining pal, salad and fries, server's go-to, angel and devil. Pillowy fries, mayo, irresistible."

"Skip Starbucks.  Support local joints.  Beehive's got the best buzz, but Crazy Mocha's no slouch either.  Great coffee, teas, smoothies, and desserts.  Just watch out for the family-sized sweets if you're diabetic and solo.  Free Wi-Fi too.  Used to be Dancing Goats.  Name's changed a few times.  Sip, maybe?  Now they're all over Pittsburgh, even at the Carnegie Library."

"A quick oil change didst require our presence,
And thus, a movie didst we decide to witness.
The line for tickets moved with haste and ease,
And friendly was the cashier, in truth, didst please.

The lobby, clean and well-kept, didst greet our eyes,
And helpful, the ticket taker, didst direct our prize.
Food, we didst not partake, for full were we,
But well-organized, the snack bar, didst seem to be.

The theater, in good repair, didst play its part,
Clean seats, a comfortable view, didst reach our heart.
Smaller, the auditorium, may have been,
Yet clear, the screen, didst make the movie seen.

In conclusion, an A, this place doth earn,
For pleasant, the experience, didst truly learn."

"Slick joint with top-shelf cocktails and a clientele made for gawking. People-watching paradise. Like the DB who splurged on a bottle of Cristal for two Russian bombshells and chugged it. Shots of Cristal, never a dull moment in Vegas. Then he orders regular shots. Um, shouldn't that have been the other way around? \n\nAnyway, swing by for a swell cocktail. Their mixology game is on point. Had a drink with maraschino liqueur, vodka, rose wine, and three raspberries. Tasty! Bartenders are friendly, quick, and know their stuff, making your visit even better."

"A fair establishment, indeed, for a hearty morning meal,
In the manner of America, or the Philippines, doth reveal.
The wait, though not too long, didst pass, as we didst bide our time,
And the red velvet pancakes, oh, how they didst shine!

A worthy venture, this eatery, for those who do seek,
A breakfast fit for a king, or a humble freeman, to speak.
So gather round, good friends, and partake in the cheer,
For here, in this place, doth lie a most excellent breakfast, my dear!"

"I gotta admit, I like this store. It's a big box joint, but they got a hell of a selection on outdoor gear. Better than REI, in my opinion. They're the only ones in town that carry SUP stuff too. The staff's pretty knowledgeable, not like those snobs at the smaller shops. They ain't got the super high-end gear, but if you're serious about outdoor activities, you probably got your own spot to shop anyway. Good place for beginners though."

"Marvelous sandwiches, priced so fair,  
At this establishment, thou shalt find,  
Tasty treats that doth please thine taste,  
And fill thy belly with delight.  

The number two, a triple decker,  
With turkey, pastrami, and rye,  
Doth stand out amongst the rest,  
A feast for thine eyes, and thine guest.  

So, if thou art in search of sustenance,  
That doth satisfy, and doth not dent,  
Thy purse, then look no further,  
For this place doth provide, in abundance."

"Verily, not so vile a choice, my friend,
Considering the scant options at hand.
The staff, in cheerful mood did tend,
With efficiency, to our each demand.
And lo, the victuals, hot and fresh,
Didst make their way to our eager flesh."

A most excellent inn, with service of the highest quality, I do declare. Well-appointed chambers for meetings and gatherings, and Wi-Fi that doth function with great haste. A bit pricey, perchance, yet still a worthy abode, save for the thrifty traveler, who might find a more budget-friendly option nearby, at the Marriott, a mere stone's throw away. (497 tokens)

"Hark! When e'er I seek my daily needs,
Fresh fruit, meat, seafood, and delicatessen,
And find them not at fresh and easy's store,
I venture forth to this place once more.
A better choice and quality, priced just right,
Doth make my shopping experience a delight.
But alas, there be some items, dear to me,
That fresh and easy, near my home, doth hold,
So there, my shopping journey doth begin and end,
For convenience's sake, my heart doth wend."

"Hark! What wondrous fish doth lie within this place?
Three of us didst partake in meals most fair,
Ono sandwich, tacos of fish, and chips of the sea.
A small venue, with ordering at the counter, 'twas,
Yet the atmosphere didst exude a Hawaiian glee.
The staff, so friendly and full of mirth, didst serve us well."

"Hark, good sirs, to my words of praise for Safeway,
A store most wondrous, where all needs are met in play.
This location, dear to me, doth hold a special place,
Where FnE and McDowell's Safeway cannot compare in grace.

One-stop shopping, indeed, it doth provide,
From US Bank to pharmacy, all necessities abide.
But alas, late night shoppers, take heed,
For slow checkout lines, a woeful deed.

Yet, fear not, for produce, fresh and fair,
Doth fill the shelves, a bounty beyond compare.
And certain products, always in stock,
A treasure trove, for which my heart doth knock."

"Upon our arrival at yon eatery, we were told 'twould be a brief wait ere our table was prepared. No bother, thought I, for my spouse and I did order potions at the bar, and waited patiently for our table to be readied. But lo, when our hostess did summon us to our table, she didst not proffer to convey our draughts thither. Alack, 'twas vexing indeed, for who doth wish to bear a martini glass, clad in heels and burdened with a purse, unto their seat? Yet, this aside, our repast did prove most delectable. The lobster bisque, which they did graciously partition for us, did taste divine, and we did share the rib eye, cooked to perfection, medium rare, and a side of risotto, lest we be o'erfilled. Our server and his minions did attend to us with care, and e'en hastened our victuals, that we might not miss our spectacle. Well done, good sirs!"

"Hark! If thou find thyself in Newhaven's bounds,
Take heed of Porto and Fi, a place most profound.
A deli and cafe, where thou mayst partake
Of sustenance and drink, and tarry awhile, forsooth.

When I did toil in Granton's environs near,
My comrade and I would oft repair hither, dear.
For lunch, we'd savor, and our spirits lift,
For 'twas a treat, indeed, a moment to enrich our rift.

Their victuals, fine! They strive to source them local,
And such endeavor doth make each dish most palatable.
Even a humble sandwich, delectable and neat,
Doth satisfy thy hunger, and doth make thy spirit meet.

Their cakes, oh! How they doth delight mine eyes,
Chocolate and beetroot, a curious surprise.
Yet, fear not, fair traveler, for this odd pair,
Doth complement each other, beyond compare.

Busy, it may be, for the townsfolk do embrace,
This haven of gastronomy, with open arms and grace.
But wait, good sir, for 'tis worth the while,
To partake of Porto and Fi's gentle smile."

"Aye, fair traveler, thou hast found a place most rare,
Off the beaten path of Mill St., a culinary lair.
The victuals, fresh as the morning dew, didst delight,
Pad thai, a dish most wondrous, a true gastronomic sight.
Beef salad and spring rolls, a duet of flavors bold,
Didst stir within me a craving, a hunger most untold.
Each dish, a masterpiece, didst leave me in awe,
Alas, a draught of ale or wine, I didst not draw."

"Hark, my dear, what luck! A cafe near the stadium,
With friendly servers, charm, and glee.
The dining room was full, alas,
So out to the patio we did stray.

We ordered at the counter with ease,
And waited not long for our drinks with cheer.
I savored the Melon Mojito, oh so sweet,
My boyfriend's pulled pork sandwich, a treat to eat.

Great service, delectable fare,
A cozy atmosphere, beyond compare.
This cafe, a gem, for brunch or lunch,
I highly recommend, with no hunch."

"Wi-fi gratis gana mi corazÃ³n cada vez. No hay muchos lugares de carga, pero hay muchas sillas de rocanrol. He estado aquÃ­ varias veces y siempre disfruto de mi breve estancia. Hay muchos Starbucks dispersos por todas partes, asÃ­ que no tengas miedo, hay mucho cafÃ© aquÃ­."
"Tommy, the waiter, is top-notch. Gigi, always friendly. Good menu variety. Happy hour needs more options. The Lotus Roll, the best in town."

"Hark! What happy hours doth this establishment boast?
And service most excellent, if fortune doth smile
Upon thee, and grant thee Aaron's guiding hand,
A place to sit, and rest thy weary feet awhile.
Methinks 'tis thanks they doth deserve, for longevity
In trade, a testament to their great worthiness."

"Methinks these donuts be most wondrous fair,
A sweet delight that doth my senses cheer.
If thou art on a diet, have but one,
And when thy guilt doth rise, have another, prithee,
To remind thee why thy indulgence was worth the fee."

"Hark! What merriment we found within this place,
A feast fit for a king, with food of grace.
Though slow in coming, 'twas worth the wait,
For flavors that did dance upon our plate.
The lentils, oh how they did delight,
And plantains, verily, a wondrous sight.
The beef, alack, a mite dry, yet full of zest,
A true delight, and worth the quest.
An eclectic menu, diverse and grand,
I do confess, I shall return to this land.
The owner, a gentleman of great renown,
Our server, friendly, helpful, and crowned.
This place, a gem, for lunch or eve's repast,
A choice most excellent, and one to savor fast."

"Hark! What wondrous feast doth lie before mine eyes?
A chimi of carne asada, by the gods, how prize!
Combo number twenty, crispy and full of savour,
With guacamole aplenty, a true gastronomic favour.
The staff, they sang and laughed in merry cheer,
A place most pleasant, and I shall visit here."

"Hark! A tale of South Point Hotel, I pray thee, listen well. 'Tis a place of wonder, a bit off the beaten path, yet all-inclusive, so thou needst not venture forth. Bowling, bingo, movies, casino, and more, they have it all. And lo, a daily Texas Hold'em tourney doth take place, a mere $55 buy-in, and I, myself, have emerged victorious thrice. Newer it may be, but clean and well-kept, it doth remain.

A word of caution, fair traveler, for on one visit, maintenance did cause a power outage in the dead of night. But fear not, for I, a wearer of CPAP, didst not even stir. Rooms, most affordable, and shouldst thou join their email list and players club, invitations to return at lower rates, thou shalt receive.

In conclusion, South Point Hotel, a gem it be, and highly recommended, by mine own hand, doth it stand."
